Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days.
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and
your contract.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.

ALLEGATION:
On 8/10/21, two youth had sexual intercourse in one of the youth's room at the
facility. All staff were notified, and a behavioral plan has been implemented.
2

INVESTIGATION:
On August 13, 2021, I interviewed Director in person at the facility with another
DHHS Worker to discuss the complaint. A list of staff and youth to interview was
provided. Director stated she made the decision to have a staff transport a youth
that was having an asthma attack to the hospital knowing it would leave the facility
out of ratio. The Director felt the youth’s medical need was more important than
staff-to-resident ratio. The on-call administrator met the youth and staff person at
the hospital, then the staff person returned to the facility.
On August 13, 2021, I interviewed Staff 1 in person at the facility with another DHHS
Worker. Staff 1 reported there was an emergency at the facility the night of August
10, 2021, where a youth was taken to the hospital by staff. Staff 1 reported this left
the facility with eight youth and two staff. Staff 1 reported five youth were in the
media room and he could not recall where the other three youth were at the time of
passing medication. Staff 1 reported Staff 2 sat with her back to the double doors
leading outside so she could watch the youth in the media room and down both
hallways of where the youth sleep. Staff 1 reported he was in the doorway of the
office passing medication and also able to see the youth in the media room.
Staff 1 reported he was in the office, calling youths’ names to pass out medication.
Staff 1 stated he called Youth A’s name three times before Youth A came to the
office to get his medication. Staff 1 reported he heard Staff 2 ask Youth B what she
was doing and where she came from. Staff 1 stated he never saw Youth B in the
media room or walk through the media room. Staff 1 reported the facility was out of
ratio while Staff 4 transported a youth to the Reed City Hospital.
On August 13, 2021, I interviewed Staff 2 in person at the facility with another DHHS
Worker. Staff 2 reported that right before medications had to be passed that a youth
was taken to the hospital by another staff. Staff 2 stated there were nine youth and
two staff. Staff 2 stated Youth B went to her bedroom prior to medications being
passed. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 checked on Youth A in his bedroom right before
Staff 1 started to pass medication. Staff 2 reported checking on Youth B in Youth
B’s bedroom prior to Staff 1 passing medications.
Staff 2 stated she sat with her back to the front doors so she could watch the media
room and the hallways. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 was in the office passing medication
to the youth. Staff 2 stated she saw Youth B run out from the boy’s hallway into the
kitchen. Staff 2 stated she asked Youth B what she was doing. Staff 2 stated at this
time Youth A entered the media room from his bedroom to get his medication. Staff
2 stated that Youth A and Youth B sat in the media room with the other youth, and
she heard some of them saying something about, “first time.”
Staff 2 reported that she talked with Youth B, and she said that she had sex with
Youth A. Staff 2 reported prior to medications being passed Youth A was in his
bedroom on his gaming system. Staff 2 stated Youth B was in her bedroom prior to

medications being passed. The bedrooms are on different hallways. Staff 2 denied
ever seeing Youth B come out of her bedroom, cross in front of her through the
media room and walk down the boy’s hallway. Staff 2 guessed Youth A went out the
window in the girl’s hallway and entered the window in either the boy’s hallway or
Youth A’s bedroom. Staff 2 reported the facility was out of ratio while Staff 4
transported a youth to the Reed City Hospital.
On August 13, 2021, I interviewed Staff 3 in person at the facility with another DHHS
Worker. Staff 3 reported he met with Youth A and Youth A admitted to having sex
with Youth B. Youth A described it as consensual. Staff 3 reported Youth A told him
Youth B got caught by staff when Youth B walked out of Youth A’s bedroom.
On August 13, 2021, I interviewed Staff 4 in person at the facility with another DHHS
Worker. Staff 4 reported she took the youth that was having an asthma attack to the
hospital and was not at the facility when Youth B was caught coming out of Youth
A’s bedroom. Staff 4 stated as soon as she returned to the facility from the hospital,
the youth were talking about Youth A and Youth B having sex. Staff 4 reported
hearing rumors that Youth A and Youth B were going to try and run away and have
sex. Staff 4 reported she believes that Youth A and Youth B took advantage of the
situation where a staff was gone at the hospital to get together. Staff 4 reported the
facility was out of ratio while Staff 4 transported a youth to the Reed City Hospital.
Staff 4 reported leaving the facility at approximately 8:00pm and returning to the
facility approximately 8:54pm. During this time there were eight youth and two staff.
On August 13, 2021, I interviewed Youth A in person at the facility with another
DHHS Worker. Youth A stated two staff, he could not remember who, were
watching the other youth in the media room when Youth B entered his bedroom.
Youth A stated he, “does not know how” Youth B got into his bedroom. Youth A
stated he had sex with Youth B and when Youth B walked out of his bedroom staff
saw Youth B. Youth A stated, “the opportunity presented itself” because there was a
staff at the hospital with a youth.
On August 13, 2021, I interviewed Youth B in person at the facility with another
DHHS Worker. Youth B stated it was “preplanned” that she would go to Youth A’s
bedroom to have sex. Youth B reported the way Staff 4 was sitting, Staff 4 did not
see her go out her door and come in the window in the kitchen. Youth B was asked
to describe how she left her bedroom and entered the kitchen window a couple of
times as the scenario does not make sense as a way to get into Youth A’s bedroom.
Youth B did not change her description of how she entered Youth A’s bedroom.
On August 13, 2021, I interviewed Youth C in person at the facility. Youth C
reported he was sitting in the media room the night Youth A and Youth B had sex.
Youth C stated Staff 2 was sitting with her back facing the door that leads outside
and watching the youth in the media room. Youth C stated Staff 1 was in the office
passing medication. Youth C denies ever seeing Youth B cross the media room and

enter the boy’s hallway. Youth C reported Youth B got caught coming out of Youth
A’s bedroom.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
 Eagle Village Residential Services Standard of Operating Procedures;
Supervision of Residents – “During awake hours, if there are any kids in the
sleep wing (one or more) or in their bedrooms, a staff member must place
themselves in the hallway for proper supervision…”
 Incident Reports for Youth A and Youth B dated 08/10/2021
 Safety Plans for Youth A and Youth B
 Eagle Village Residential Services Standard Operating Procedures: Staffing
Ratios – the ratio during awake hours a 1 to 3 staff/resident ratio shall be
maintained at all times.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4127 Staff-to-resident ratio.
(3) The ratio formula for direct care workers shall
correspond with the institution's purpose and the needs of
the residents and shall assure the continual safety,
protection, and direct care and supervision of residents.
ANALYSIS: The facility was out of ratio for approximately 54 minutes. Eagle
Village Hainley House staffing ratio during awake hours are a
one to three staff/resident ratio. During approximately 8:00pm –
8:54pm there were two staff and eight youth.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, I recommend no changes in
the license status.
